alert.note: Alert for Austin; Brazos; Burleson; Colorado; Grimes; Madison; Waller; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 6:51AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...HOT TEMPERATURES AND ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ACROSS THE BRAZOS VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON... Air temperatures this afternoon in the Brazos Valley will top out around 102째F-103째F, which is borderline Heat Advisory criteria. Additionally, heat Index values will top out around 106째F-108째F this afternoon in the Brazos Valley. Practicing heat safety is encouraged. Drink plenty of water, take frequent breaks in the shade or indoors if working outside, avoid strenuous outdoor activities during the hottest part of the day, and ALWAYS look before you lock your vehicle. Drier air and breezy winds will result in elevated fire weather conditions across the Brazos Valley today. Relative humidity values this afternoon will bottom out in the 25%-35% range along with southerly winds at 10-17 mph and dry to critically dry fuels. Please use extreme caution if working with flammable material outdoors today. Grasses and other fine fuels can ignite and spread quickly in low humidity and windy conditions.
